result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin Wayne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and/or school.  No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees, or civil judgment will be entered.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and  he may not vote in any electin until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds defendant was under the age of 25 at the tme of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdmeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfuly completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommendd treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drug or alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Wayne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: PRINTED IN ERROR, TWICE.  DUPLICATE
DUPLICATE, printed twice  in error.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has completed community service and attending school at MATC.  Defendant last 2 test were negative,. however the defendant has tested positive for non-prescriptive drugs.

State moves to revoke the agreement.  Defense argues against the revocation and request a brief extension.   Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Statements made as to sentencing.
Defendant sentenced to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested negative and consistently attending treatment.  Defendant has obtained GED.  Defendant has completed 29 1/2 hours of community service.  Defendant needs to submit to additional clean UAs.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant completed community service and is attending treatment. Defendant is looking for employment and attemting to enroll in school. 

With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed, Letter from Running Rebels Community Organization.
Fokus Family Service progress report, received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is attending treatment, but continues to test positive.  Review hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.  

Defendant is actively engaged in treatment.  Defendant has enrolled in school and will begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Report from Focus is not so good.  Needs more clean urine screens.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for 12-16-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Hanna Kolberg for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 6 months.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Court ordered case adjourned for Review Hearing on 10-28-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 6.  Review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in room 313 of the safety building.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 09-05-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).    Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1812 W Highland Ave, #1015, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant awaiting a TAD Assessment. Case adjourned for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 26.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Marvin Wayne not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Marvin Wayne in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Marvin Wayne in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Marvin Wayne in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
